page.title: 14CHICKEN FARM:NORTH/ELTON
page.content: A farm of 13 acres rearing chickens for slaughter. 140,000 chickens penned at anyone time. Purchased as day old chicks and sold for slaughter at six weeks and supplied to a chain of supermarkets. The pens were heated by Calor gas and the annual heating expenditure was approx. Â£25,000. The farmhouse was modern, detached and owner-occupied. The family consisted of farmer, wife and three adult off- spring. He had lived there for 30 years, was born in the area as were his parents. He owned two cars, and shopped in Peterborough. Main leisure pursuits were golf and television. They enjoyed living there because they had no neighbours and considered there were no disadvantages.
